result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M. Pendleton

records.addlTxt:
2:26 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicole M. Pendleton in court.  Attorney David Rudolph Berman in court for Nicole M. Pendleton. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Berman is requesting an adjournment so he may speak with the health professional treating the DE so explore the potential of entering a NGI plea. Court adjourns.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Witness List
Other Acts Motion filed by ADA Tombasco

09:21 AM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicole M. Pendleton, appeared with Attorney David Rudolph Berman.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Berman states the matter is not resolved and is requesting this case be set for jury trial. Court schedules trial date.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter/correspondence re: rotation
Joint service records $0.72 ordered per advocate counsel

09:45 AM Defendant, Nicole M. Pendleton, appeared with Attorney David Rudolph Berman.  Attorney's Sydney Star & Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk
Atty David Berman appointed as advocate counsel.
to appt counsel (sent to br.4)
kmk
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: DEF CAME IN WITH PE FOR APPT OF ATTY & OR; PLACED IN CRML CLRKS BIN

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Meijer in Kenosha.
Phoned JS at 230  spoke to Nicole/jk

224PM    State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Warrant Vacated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Final Pre-Trial for May 19th, 2022 at 09:15 am.  $400  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  DE not eligible for SPD.  DE given advocate counsel paperwork today.  ts
DE schedules a voluntary appearance for 03-22-22 at 1pm Intake.   DA notified.
